page.title: 05Parkwood Hall School
page.content: Parkwood Hall is a Resedential school built on the site of a home for poor children.Previously a private house, a Convalescent Home,then a Trainee Fireman base,Parkwood was bought in 1970 by ILEA for use as a school for children with learning and social problems.At present there are 58 children aged from 7-17yrs.35 are boys and 23 are girls.A staff of 8 teachers and the headteacher are joined by a caretaker,11 cleaners,15 kitchen staff, a welfare assistant and a secretary. There are also laundry staff,bursar, seamstresses and a nurse.The school also has extensive grounds and woodland areas.The school has TVs,video,computer ,radio and tape recorders.Lessons are the same as those taught in day schools with the addition of woodwork taken in the workshop.
